profile.headline: AI & Robotics PhD Candidate @ UCL
profile.about: PhD candidate at UCL working on developing more efficient ways to train foundational robotics models for humanities most challenging dexterous manipulation tasks. I believe robotics is about to begin an enormous acceleration, and want to make this future accessible to everyone.

experience.summary:
Worked as a full-time Software Engineering Intern at Intuit for 12 weeks, as part of their QuickBooks Online (QBO) UK team developing the backend (Java) and frontend (ReactJS) of the service. -	Fixed many major bugs which were affecting large portions of the userbase-	Successfully extended the tax report module to handle the latest tax schemes. -	Developed and then conducted large scale A-B testing on an experimental design for a survey widget component.-	Learnt best practices for maintaining a large and complex code base and efficiently using Git version control and developed an excellent understand of Scrum/Agile methodologies.
            

    
    

    
        Show less

I created fun and entertaining videos for my Youtube channel targeted towards a younger audience. My videos have been viewed by over 4.1 Million people, which is an achievement I am very proud of! The success is all thanks to my proprietary software called VidFill, which let me create parody animations in a easy and quick way which would otherwise be impossible. I discuss this program in detail in the project section.

I founded, developed and now maintain the non-profit website IBrecap.com. My site aims to provide a platform for students taking the International Baccalaureate program, to share and collaborate on revision notes so that all IB students can have access to free high quality notes. The website is built upon traditional technologies such as JS, PHP and SQL and is dynamic and responsive. It has been used by over 150,000 students, has over 400 signed-up users and is continuing to grow with every passing day.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
